docs.abstract: In testimony given to the Securities and Exchange Commission, the hedge fund manager Steven A. Cohen shed some light on questionable stock trades. | A cyclical downdraft in the clean energy sector has not discouraged one prominent investor, Vinod Khosla, from committing more money to his bets. | The United States Chamber of Commerce is trying to retain its influence as another group, the Campaign to Fix the Debt, raises its profile. | The directors of Orient-Express Hotels are in an unusually secure position.

headline.main: The 'Go Fast' and 'Go Big' Fiscal Challenges

docs.abstract: Spending cuts and tax increases will help with the federal deficit, but government investment to foster long-term growth should be a core principle of deficit reduction.

docs.lead_paragraph: This analysis offers a more complete picture of taxation in the United States — the combined impact of federal, state and local taxes on American households.
docs.snippet: This analysis offers a more complete picture of taxation in the United States — the combined impact of federal, state and local taxes on American households.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite their complaints, most Americans in 2010 paid far less in total taxes — federal, state and local — than they would have paid 30 years ago, according to an analysis by The Times.

headline.seo: Most Americans Face Lower Tax Burden Than in the 80s
headline.main: Tax Burden for Most Americans Is Lower Than in the 1980s
headline.print_headline: Complaints Aside, Most Face Lower Tax Burden Than in the Reagan ’80s

docs.abstract: Most Americans, especially high earners, paid less in taxes in 2010 than they would have paid in 1980; shift is due to 30-year decline in federal income tax rates, which has offset increases in state and local taxes; report highlights how tax cuts have disproportionately favored affluent households.
docs.snippet: Despite their complaints, most Americans in 2010 paid far less in total taxes — federal, state and local — than they would have paid 30 years ago, according to an analysis by The Times.

byline.original: By BINYAMIN APPELBAUM and ROBERT GEBELOFF

docs.lead_paragraph: Multigenerational living, a throwback to the past, is a growing trend in the struggling economy, and major homebuilders are designing flexible layouts.

headline.seo: Building Homes for Modern Multigenerational Families
headline.main: Under One Roof, Building for Extended Families
headline.print_headline: Under One Roof, Building for Extended Families

docs.abstract: Many major home-builders are now offering flexible layouts to accommodate increasing number of multigenerational American families living together under one roof; tradition of housing three generations together, throwback to the past, has become a growing trend in today's struggling economy.
docs.snippet: Multigenerational living, a throwback to the past, is a growing trend in the struggling economy, and major homebuilders are designing flexible layouts.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mayor proposed rolling back the next payment deadline for property taxes; the governor announced changes in rules for insurance adjusters.

headline.seo: Bloomberg and Cuomo Detail Aid for Owners of Storm-Damaged Property
headline.main: Bloomberg and Cuomo Detail Aid for Owners of Storm-Damaged Property
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg and Cuomo Detail Aid for Owners of Storm-Damaged Property

docs.abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg unveils two tax initiatives intended to give owners of severely damaged properties some financial breathing room as they struggle to recover from Hurricane Sandy; Gov Andrew M Cuomo also announces an emergency regulation shortening the period in which an insurance adjuster must inspect a claim, hoping to offer relief for those with repair concerns in the wake of the storm.
docs.snippet: The mayor proposed rolling back the next payment deadline for property taxes; the governor announced changes in rules for insurance adjusters.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a twice-yearly report on the financial system, Mervyn A. King said British banks could be underestimating the risks facing them and should be urged to raise their reserves.

headline.main: British Banks May Be Undercapitalized, Bank of England Governor Warns
headline.print_headline: British Banks Are Urged to Bolster Capital

docs.abstract: Bank of England report finds that British banks need more capital to protect them against fallout from the crisis in the euro zone, the Libor rate-manipulation litigation and other potential costs.
docs.snippet: In a twice-yearly report on the financial system, Mervyn A. King said British banks could be underestimating the risks facing them and should be urged to raise their reserves.

headline.main: Life, Interrupted: Real Housewives of Chemotherapy

docs.abstract: A friendship between two young women spawned laughter, a reality television spin-off idea and a plan to reach out to young adult cancer patients.
